trans-unit.source: What is Azure Key Vault?
trans-unit.target: What is Azure Key Vault?

trans-unit.source: | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Azure Key Vault helps safeguard cryptographic keys and secrets used by cloud applications and services.
trans-unit.target: Azure Key Vault helps safeguard cryptographic keys and secrets used by cloud applications and services.

trans-unit.source: By using Azure Key Vault, customers can encrypt keys and secrets (such as authentication keys, storage account keys, data encryption keys, .PFX files, and passwords) by using keys that are protected by hardware security modules (HSMs).
trans-unit.target: By using Azure Key Vault, customers can encrypt keys and secrets (such as authentication keys, storage account keys, data encryption keys, .PFX files, and passwords) by using keys that are protected by hardware security modules (HSMs).

trans-unit.source: What is Azure Key Vault?
trans-unit.target: What is Azure Key Vault?

trans-unit.source: Azure Key Vault is available in most regions.
trans-unit.target: Azure Key Vault is available in most regions.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the [Key Vault pricing page](../../../../pricing/details/key-vault/).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the [Key Vault pricing page](../../../../pricing/details/key-vault/).

trans-unit.source: Introduction
trans-unit.target: Introduction

trans-unit.source: Azure Key Vault helps safeguard cryptographic keys and secrets used by cloud applications and services.
trans-unit.target: Azure Key Vault helps safeguard cryptographic keys and secrets used by cloud applications and services.

trans-unit.source: By using Key Vault, you can encrypt keys and secrets (such as authentication keys, storage account keys, data encryption keys, .PFX files, and passwords) by using keys that are protected by hardware security modules (HSMs).
trans-unit.target: By using Key Vault, you can encrypt keys and secrets (such as authentication keys, storage account keys, data encryption keys, .PFX files, and passwords) by using keys that are protected by hardware security modules (HSMs).

trans-unit.source: For added assurance, you can import or generate keys in HSMs (keys never leave the HSM boundary).
trans-unit.target: For added assurance, you can import or generate keys in HSMs (keys never leave the HSM boundary).

trans-unit.source: The HSMs are FIPS 140-2 Level 2 validated.
trans-unit.target: The HSMs are FIPS 140-2 Level 2 validated.

trans-unit.source: Key Vault streamlines the key management process and enables you to maintain control of keys that access and encrypt your data.
trans-unit.target: Key Vault streamlines the key management process and enables you to maintain control of keys that access and encrypt your data.

trans-unit.source: Developers can create keys for development and testing in minutes, and then seamlessly migrate them to production keys.
trans-unit.target: Developers can create keys for development and testing in minutes, and then seamlessly migrate them to production keys.

trans-unit.source: Security administrators can grant (and revoke) permission to keys, as needed.
trans-unit.target: Security administrators can grant (and revoke) permission to keys, as needed.

trans-unit.source: Use the following table to better understand how Key Vault can help to meet the needs of developers and security administrators.
trans-unit.target: Use the following table to better understand how Key Vault can help to meet the needs of developers and security administrators.

trans-unit.source: Role
trans-unit.target: Role

trans-unit.source: Problem statement
trans-unit.target: Problem statement

trans-unit.source: Solved by Azure Key Vault
trans-unit.target: Solved by Azure Key Vault

trans-unit.source: Developer for an Azure application
trans-unit.target: Developer for an Azure application

trans-unit.source: “I want to write an application for Azure that uses keys for signing and encryption, but I want these to be external from my application so that the solution is suitable for an application that is geographically distributed.
trans-unit.target: “I want to write an application for Azure that uses keys for signing and encryption, but I want these to be external from my application so that the solution is suitable for an application that is geographically distributed.

trans-unit.source: I also want these keys and secrets to be protected, without having to write the code myself, and I want them to be easy for me to use from my applications, with optimal performance.”
trans-unit.target: I also want these keys and secrets to be protected, without having to write the code myself, and I want them to be easy for me to use from my applications, with optimal performance.”

trans-unit.source: √ Keys are stored in a vault and invoked by URI when needed.
trans-unit.target: √ Keys are stored in a vault and invoked by URI when needed.

trans-unit.source: √ Keys are safeguarded by Azure, using industry-standard algorithms, key lengths, and hardware security modules (HSMs).
trans-unit.target: √ Keys are safeguarded by Azure, using industry-standard algorithms, key lengths, and hardware security modules (HSMs).

trans-unit.source: √ Keys are processed in HSMs that reside in the same Azure datacenters as the applications, which provides better reliability and reduced latency than if the keys reside in a separate location, such as on-premises.
trans-unit.target: √ Keys are processed in HSMs that reside in the same Azure datacenters as the applications, which provides better reliability and reduced latency than if the keys reside in a separate location, such as on-premises.

trans-unit.source: Developer for Software as a Service (SaaS)
trans-unit.target: Developer for Software as a Service (SaaS)

trans-unit.source: “I don’t want the responsibility or potential liability for my customers’ tenant keys and secrets.
trans-unit.target: “I don’t want the responsibility or potential liability for my customers’ tenant keys and secrets.

trans-unit.source: I want the customers to own and manage their keys so that I can concentrate on doing what I do best, which is providing the core software features.”
trans-unit.target: I want the customers to own and manage their keys so that I can concentrate on doing what I do best, which is providing the core software features.”

trans-unit.source: √ Customers can import their own keys into Azure, and manage them.
trans-unit.target: √ Customers can import their own keys into Azure, and manage them.

trans-unit.source: When a SaaS application needs to perform cryptographic operations by using their customers’ keys, Key Vault does this on behalf of the application.
trans-unit.target: When a SaaS application needs to perform cryptographic operations by using their customers’ keys, Key Vault does this on behalf of the application.

trans-unit.source: The application does not see the customers’ keys.
trans-unit.target: The application does not see the customers’ keys.

trans-unit.source: Chief security officer (CSO)
trans-unit.target: Chief security officer (CSO)

trans-unit.source: “I want to know that our applications comply with FIPS 140-2 Level 2 HSMs for secure key management.
trans-unit.target: “I want to know that our applications comply with FIPS 140-2 Level 2 HSMs for secure key management.

trans-unit.source: I want to make sure that my organization is in control of the key life cycle and can monitor key usage.
trans-unit.target: I want to make sure that my organization is in control of the key life cycle and can monitor key usage.

trans-unit.source: And although we use multiple Azure services and resources, I want to manage the keys from a single location in Azure.”
trans-unit.target: And although we use multiple Azure services and resources, I want to manage the keys from a single location in Azure.”

trans-unit.source: √ HSMs are FIPS 140-2 Level 2 validated.
trans-unit.target: √ HSMs are FIPS 140-2 Level 2 validated.

trans-unit.source: √ Key Vault is designed so that Microsoft does not see or extract your keys.
trans-unit.target: √ Key Vault is designed so that Microsoft does not see or extract your keys.

trans-unit.source: √ Near real-time logging of key usage (not currently available).
trans-unit.target: √ Near real-time logging of key usage (not currently available).

trans-unit.source: √ The vault provides a single interface, regardless of how many vaults you have in Azure, which regions they support, and which applications use them.
trans-unit.target: √ The vault provides a single interface, regardless of how many vaults you have in Azure, which regions they support, and which applications use them.

trans-unit.source: Anybody with an Azure subscription can create and use key vaults.
trans-unit.target: Anybody with an Azure subscription can create and use key vaults.

trans-unit.source: Although Key Vault benefits developers and security administrators, it could be implemented and managed by an organization’s administrator who manages other Azure services for an organization.
trans-unit.target: Although Key Vault benefits developers and security administrators, it could be implemented and managed by an organization’s administrator who manages other Azure services for an organization.

trans-unit.source: For example, this administrator would sign in with an Azure subscription, create a vault for the organization in which to store keys, and then be responsible for operational tasks, such as:
trans-unit.target: For example, this administrator would sign in with an Azure subscription, create a vault for the organization in which to store keys, and then be responsible for operational tasks, such as:

trans-unit.source: Create or import a key or secret
trans-unit.target: Create or import a key or secret

trans-unit.source: Revoke or delete a key or secret
trans-unit.target: Revoke or delete a key or secret

trans-unit.source: Authorize users or applications to manage or use keys and secrets
trans-unit.target: Authorize users or applications to manage or use keys and secrets

trans-unit.source: Configure key usage (for example, sign or encrypt)
trans-unit.target: Configure key usage (for example, sign or encrypt)

trans-unit.source: Monitor key usage
trans-unit.target: Monitor key usage

trans-unit.source: This administrator would then provide developers with URIs to call from their applications, and provide their security administrator with key usage logging information.
trans-unit.target: This administrator would then provide developers with URIs to call from their applications, and provide their security administrator with key usage logging information.

trans-unit.source: Key usage logging information is not currently available.
trans-unit.target: Key usage logging information is not currently available.

trans-unit.source: ![Overview of Azure Key Vault][1]
trans-unit.target: ![Overview of Azure Key Vault][1]

trans-unit.source: Developers can also manage the keys directly, by using APIs.
trans-unit.target: Developers can also manage the keys directly, by using APIs.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Key Vault](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn903625.aspx) in the Microsoft Azure documentation library on MSDN.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Key Vault](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn903625.aspx) in the Microsoft Azure documentation library on MSDN.

trans-unit.source: Next Steps
trans-unit.target: Next Steps

trans-unit.source: For a getting started tutorial for an administrator, see [Get Started with Azure Key Vault](key-vault-get-started.md).
trans-unit.target: For a getting started tutorial for an administrator, see [Get Started with Azure Key Vault](key-vault-get-started.md).

trans-unit.source: For more information about using keys and secrets with Azure Key Vault, see [About Keys and Secrets](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn903623.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information about using keys and secrets with Azure Key Vault, see [About Keys and Secrets](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn903623.aspx).

trans-unit.target: test
